title: Marriage And Morals
description:
Marriage and Morals by Bertrand Russell is for some reason omitted from collections of his works, currently and  currently available.

A very important work that stands the test of time very well, containing fundamental ideas of sexual morality, commitment, responsibility, fairness, health, and freedom. Russell's ideas were considered horrifically immoral and he was roundly condemned for their publication.

This book should be read by anyone who's thoughtful and considering alternate sexual moralities. Russell covers a lot of ground and brings up many important points.
